articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Captains Regent of San Marino
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Captains Regent of San Marino
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Anna Maria Muccioli and Giancarlo Capicchioni, captains regent of the Republic of San Marino, on the occasion of its national day. 
					 The message wished the captains regent successes in their work for the development of the country and welfare of its people.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets First Vice-Chairman of Russian Federation Council
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets First Vice-Chairman of Russian Federation Council
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Alexandr Torshyn, first vice-chairman of the Federation Council of Russia, and his party who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.

articles.title: Senior Party, State Officials Visit Lodging Quarters of Participants in 13th National Meeting of Educators
articles.content:
Senior Party, State Officials Visit Lodging Quarters of Participants in 13th National Meeting of Educators
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials on Tuesday visited the lodging quarters of the participants in the 13th National Meeting of Educators. 
					 Pak Pong Ju, Choe Thae Bok, Vice-Premier of the Cabinet Kim Yong Jin, Department Director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Han Kwang Bok, Chairman of the Education Commission Kim Sung Du and other officials of the WPK Central Committee visited the lodging quarters and met with the participants in the meeting.
					
					 They congratulated the officials and teachers upon their successes in educating the rising generation under the uplifted banner of the theses on socialist education.
					
					 They requested them to exalt forever the immortal feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, who provided a great programme for an educational revolution, further develop the educational work and thus bring up more revolutionary talents who will push forward the building of a thriving socialist nation, remaining true to the idea and intention of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Grave of Kim Po Hyon
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Grave of Kim Po Hyon
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the grave of ardent patriot Kim Po Hyon at Mangyongdae on Tuesday on the occasion of the 59th anniversary of his demise.
					 Seen standing before the grave was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, O Su Yong, Im Chol Ung, vice-premier of the Cabinet, officials of party and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions and educational bodies and working people in the city.
					
					 A wreath was placed before the grave in the name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Also laid before the grave were wreaths in the name of working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, revolutionary schools, educational bodies, and party and power organs and farms in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the noble life of Kim Po Hyon.

articles.title: Educators Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Educators Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Participants in the 13th National Meeting of Educators visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Tuesday.
					 They paid high tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They paid homage to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are preserved and the halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Delegation of DPRK Supreme Court Back Home
articles.content:
Delegation of DPRK Supreme Court Back Home
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the DPRK Supreme Court led by President Pak Myong Chol came back home on Tuesday after visiting Russia.

articles.title: Kanji Inoki Leaves
articles.content:
Kanji Inoki Leaves 
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Kanji Inoki, member of the House of Councilors of Japan who is also chief director of the Sports Peace Community Association of Japan, and his party left here for home on Tuesday. 
					 Also departing were foreign players who took part in the Pyongyang International Pro-Wrestling Games. 
					
					 They were seen off at the airport by Jang Ung, chairman of the International Martial Arts Games Committee, and Ma Chol Su, secretary general of the DPRK-Japan Friendship Association.

articles.title: Natural Nano Disinfectant Developed
articles.content:
Natural Nano Disinfectant Developed
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The Saegisul (new technology) Trading Company in the DPRK developed natural nano water disinfectant.
					 The disinfectant is made with nano-silver and porous adsorbent which consists of tourmaline and Kumgang medical stone mixture.
					
					 It helps sterilize tens of kinds of pathogenic microorganisms, including colon bacillus, dysentery bacillus and paratyphoid bacillus, and prevent the secondary contamination of water. It also removes heavy metal ion, active oxygen and other unhealthy matters and improves the quality of water.
					
					 Water, treated with the natural nano disinfectant, relishes of mineral water and prevents food from spoiling. The disinfectant is available for sterilizing vegetables, fruits and vessels.
					
					 This nano water disinfectant is now very popular among citizens as it is easy to use.
					
					 It won a high appreciation at the recent 13th National Exhibition of Inventions and New Technologies.

articles.title: New Types of Bags Appraised at Exhibition
articles.content:
New Types of Bags Appraised at Exhibition
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Various types of home-made bags were displayed at the recent National Exhibition of August 3 Consumer Goods in the DPRK to win a great popularity.
					 Among them are fashionable handbags for women of all ages and briefcases for men, made by the Tongdaewon District Housewives' Workteam Management Office in Pyongyang.
					
					 The office, with a 15-year-long history in manufacturing bags, has produced various kinds and types of bags with peculiar designs to meet the consumers' demand and taste. Its products are now very popular among citizens.
					
					 Its Director Ri Yong Hui told KCNA that the office would make more bags of different types and colors.

articles.title: U.S. Deputy Defense Secretary's Reckless Remarks on "Missile Threat" from DPRK Assailed
articles.content:
U.S. Deputy Defense Secretary's Reckless Remarks on "Missile Threat" from DPRK Assailed
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- U.S. Deputy Defense Secretary Robert Work, touring south Korea recently, talked about a trite "threat" from the DPRK. He let loose a spate of sophism that there is great likelihood of "provocation" from the DPRK and the U.S. is watching "missile threat" from the DPRK.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this is aimed to make "missile threat" from the DPRK a fait accompli in a bid to build a missile shield in south Korea under the pretext of it.
					
					 The U.S. much touted "missile threat" from the DPRK is nothing but sheer sophism, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. moves for building the missile shield in south Korea are obviously a product of the U.S. military strategy to upset the regional strategic equilibrium and contain big powers in its vicinity.
					
					 After adopting a pivot to Asia-Pacific policy for aggression, pursuant to its scenario for dominating the world, the U.S. is pursuing a strategy of laying a military siege to its potential rivals in the region, notably China, and containing and pressurizing it.
					
					 The U.S. is keen to plug south Korea into the missile shield in an effort to tighten the siege to China so that it may minimize its damage and maximize the effect of strike at the other party.
					
					 This is evidenced by the fact that the X-band radar to go operational together with THAAD which the U.S. is planning to deploy in south Korea covers major areas of China as its detecting sphere is 1 000 km.
					
					 The U.S. groundless accusation against the DPRK is nothing but a shameless and cynical ploy to conceal its true colors as the arch criminal upsetting the regional military equilibrium and sparking off an arms race and shift the blame for it onto others.
					
					 Regardless of what others may say, the DPRK will as ever make every possible effort to ensure peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia.

articles.title: Minju Joson Snubs S. Korean Authorities' Wordplay Intended to Mislead Public Opinion
articles.content:
Minju Joson Snubs S. Korean Authorities' Wordplay Intended to Mislead Public Opinion 
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet authorities are vociferating about "the possibility of south-north dialogue" as soon as the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military drills were over.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard: This is a height of shamelessness and an intolerable mockery and insult to the army and people of the DPRK. 
					
					 If the south Korean authorities want to talk about "the possibility of south-north dialogue", they should apologize to the nation for staging UFG, to begin with, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 Their gibberish about "dialogue" is intended to mislead public opinion by creating impression that they are interested in the dialogue and make it believe that they are a main player in handling the matter of the north-south relations. 
					
					 They have neither sincere will to hold dialogue and mend the north-south relations nor qualifications to talk about it. 
					
					 If they truly hope for the north-south dialogue, they should make an apology for having bedeviled the north-south relations by staging UFG, to begin with, and declare internally and externally that they would never stage nuclear war drills against the north together with outside forces in the future. 
					
					 Talking about "the possibility of south-north dialogue" without taking any measure would only bring to light their shameless nature before the whole world and touch off bitter indignation and protest among all Koreans. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should bear this in mind and stop such wordplay to mislead public opinion at home and abroad.

articles.title: Indiscriminate Suppression of Jongyojo Condemned in S. Korea
articles.content:
Indiscriminate Suppression of Jongyojo Condemned in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The Teachers Union of south Korea (Jongyojo) in a statement on August 30 condemned the puppet forces for cracking down on Jongyojo, according to Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 The statement recalled that on August 29 the security authorities issued a warrant of arrest for three members including the chairman of Jongyojo for the mere reason that they took the lead in Jongyojo's campaign for publishing a declaration on the situation and the campaign for leaving school early, etc.
					
					 It is an all-out politically-motivated suppression of Jongyojo, the statement said, adding the action of Jongyojo can never be punished as it is a legitimate exercise of its right.
					
					 The "government's" indiscriminate suppression will be recorded in history as an act of trampling down the freedom of expression, it charged.

articles.title: Ceaseless Violence in S. Korean Puppet Army
articles.content:
Ceaseless Violence in S. Korean Puppet Army
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Cases of violence again broke out in units of the south Korean puppet army, sparking off public criticism, according to MBC of south Korea on August 29.
					 Corporals of a unit in Phochon, Kyonggi Province have frequently brought together a group of two-three junior privates of a platoon and cruelly beat them since June. They unhesitatingly committed crimes little short of torture such as searing junior private's arm with heated spoon and inflicting burns on him.
					
					 A corporal of a unit in Ryonchon, Kyonggi Province has often beat his junior privates since January, putting a dead fly into the mouth of a junior private and committing a sexual abuse.

articles.title: Suppression of Progressive Religionist under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Suppression of Progressive Religionist under Fire in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet police is suppressing Rev. Pak Chang Sin of the Jonju Parish Priests Group of the south Korean Catholic Priests' Council for Justice on charges of the violation of the ill-famed "Security Law", according to Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea on August 31.
					 At the mass on the situation held in Kunsan in November last year Pak made a speech to the effect that the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises pose a threat to the north.
					
					 The puppet North Jolla Provincial District Police Agency is going to summon and investigate Pak under the pretext of looking into the complaint made by conservative organizations, claiming what he said was aimed to favor the north and assumed the nature of benefiting the enemy. 
					
					 The Catholic Priests' Council for Justice termed the security authorities' attempt to investigate Pak's speech by invoking the "Security Law" a clear suppression of religion.

articles.title: S. Korean Ruling Quarters Accused of Disturbing Probe into Truth behind Ferry Sewol Disaster
articles.content:
S. Korean Ruling Quarters Accused of Disturbing Probe into Truth behind Ferry Sewol Disaster 
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People on Monday in an editorial denounced the south Korean puppet ruling quarters for disturbing the probe into the truth behind the ferry Sewol disaster. 
					 The editorial said:
					
					 The "Saenuri Party" branded the actions of people from all walks of life demanding the probe into the truth behind the disaster and the institution of a special law as anti-"government" actions. Not content with this, the party pressurized the bereaved families to give up the right to investigate and indict those responsible for the tragedy. 
					
					 From the beginning it claimed the captain, ship-owner and maritime police, etc. only were accountable for the accident, thereby preventing the ad hoc committee for state investigation into the ferry Sewol tragedy from holding even a hearing. 
					
					 The prosecution's doubtful attitude at the trial of the accident proves its attempt to hold only the ship-owner and crew members responsible for the accident. 
					
					 The conservative forces also launched a general offensive to split the bereaved families from other people. 
					
					 However, the actions for probing the truth behind the accident are invariably going on. Though the ferry Sewol sank, the truth cannot be written off.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Flayed for Inciting Confrontation with Fellow Countrymen
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Flayed for Inciting Confrontation with Fellow Countrymen
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet Supreme Court sentenced to a prison term the permanent representative of the Association of Victims of "the Security Law" on Sept. 1.
					 The fascist court accused the permanent representative of posting poems and articles praising the north on website from January, 2011 to November the next year and quoting articles posted on website of the north, charging him with a violation of the SL.
					
					 At a trial held at the Seoul Central District Court on August 29 the puppet prosecution demanded prison terms for four teachers under the Teachers Union.
					
					 The prosecution took such actions against them on the suspicions that what they taught was systematic ideological education and designed to spread the north's social system.
					
					 Meanwhile, the puppet constitutional court made a decision to restrict the political activities of teachers, thus backing the moves of the fascist authorities to outlaw the Teachers Union.

articles.title: Memorial Service for Korean Victims Held in Japan
articles.content:
Memorial Service for Korean Victims Held in Japan
 Tokyo, September 1 (KNS-KCNA) -- A memorial service was held by Korean compatriots in Tokyo on Monday, 91 years since the Japanese imperialists mercilessly murdered Koreans during the great Kanto quake. The service was held before the monument to Korean victims of great Kanto quake in Tokyo. 
					 Present there were Pak Ku Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), Hwang Myong, chairman of the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of Chongryon, leading officials of organizations and enterprises of Chongryon, Chongryon officials and compatriots in Kanto and Japanese personages including the deputy representative of the Tokyo Ward Assemblymen's Liaison Society for the Promotion of Japan-Korea Friendship.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the victims.
					
					 Hwang Myong in his memorial address said lots of Koreans were forcibly drafted to the alien land and met grievous deaths in the period of the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and what is most unforgettable in the bitter history is the Japanese imperialists' massacres of Koreans during the great Kanto quake.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Even though 91 years have passed since that time the Japanese authorities still cover up or turn their faces away from the historical fact of the massacres of Koreans, and are taking hostile stand to the DPRK and Chongryon and continuously resorting to suppression and human rights abuses against the Koreans in Japan.
					
					 The Japanese authorities should draw a due lesson from their policy of aggression and colonial rule in the past century, stop the national persecution and violation of rights of Chongryon and the Koreans in Japan and normalize as soon as possible the DPRK-Japan relations based on the proper liquidation of the past under the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration.
					
					 Speeches were made by Japanese personages and others.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Barring DPRK's Cheerleading Squad from Participating in Inchon Asiad
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Barring DPRK's Cheerleading Squad from Participating in Inchon Asiad 
 Beijing, September 2 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China Tuesday made public a statement accusing the south Korean authorities of barring the DPRK's cheerleading squad from taking part in the 17th Asian Games. 
					 The statement lashed out at the south Korean puppet authorities for letting loose a spate of sophism to evade the responsibility for blocking the participation of the north's cheerleading squad in the Asian Games.
					
					 The true colors of the south Korean authorities have already been brought to light, the statement noted, and went on: 
					
					 The action taken by them patently proved that they are abusing sacred sports and cultural exchange for their sinister political purpose and confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north and blocking the national reconciliation and unity and the improvement of the north-south relations. 
					
					 It also laid bare the double-dealing nature of the south Korean authorities who oft-repeat words "confidence," "dialogue" and "cooperation."
					
					 The Koreans in China cannot repress the bitter anger at their traitorous behavior of depriving the cheerleading squad of the opportunity to take part in the Asian Games, not content with fostering distrust and antagonism, disregarding the DPRK's efforts to improve the north-south relations and achieve national reconciliation. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities will have to pay a high price for having worked hard to exploit even sports games as an opportunity of fostering the confrontation with fellow countrymen and distrust between them.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Redeem Its Past
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Redeem Its Past
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- There took place a meeting of Japanese civic organizations in Tokyo on August 27 to demand Japan's apology and reparation for the war crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists and boost solidarity with Asian countries.
					 Present there were Koichi Ishizaka, co-representative and secretary general of the Liaison Council for Demanding Denuclearization and Peace in Northeast Asia and Normalization of the Relations between Japan and the DPRK, Nishizawa Kiyoshi, representative of the Tokyo Group for Probing Truth behind Forcible Drafting of Koreans, Kazuo Hasegawa, representative of the Liaison Council for Opposing Exclusion of Korean Schools from the Tuition-free Program for Senior High Schools, and other Japanese personages of various circles, officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, Son Hyong Gun, chairman of the Japanese Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, and citizens.
					
					 Speeches were made by personages of Japanese civic organizations.
					
					 They accused the Japanese government of denying its past history and refusing to make a formal apology and reparation for such crimes perpetrated by the Japanese imperialists as forcible drafting of Koreans and sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					
					 A campaign demanding the immediate application of the tuition-free program to the Korean schools is gaining in scope and strength but it has not yet come true, they said, urging their government to accept it.
					
					 They evinced their resolution to seek Japan's apology and reparation for the Japanese imperialists' past war crimes and conduct dynamic solidarity activities to bring earlier the normalization of the relations between Japan and the DPRK and the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea based on the north-south joint declarations.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Austria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Austria
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us March Forward Dynamically towards Final Victory, Holding Higher the Banner of Songun" was brought out in booklet by the Joseph Gebauer Publishing House in Vienna, Austria on August 25.
					 This is the speech made by Kim Jong Un at the military parade held to celebrate the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung on April 15, Juche 101 (2012). It says the 100 year-long history of Kim Il Sung's nation clearly proves the immutable truth that outstanding leaders assure the dignity and prosperity of the country and the nation.
					
					 It sets forth the tasks to be fulfilled to glorify the dignity of Songun Korea for all ages and successfully accomplish the cause of building a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by Swiss Organization on Its Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by Swiss Organization on Its Website
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Only Victory and Glory Are in Store for Us Who Are Advancing under the Unfurled Flag Bearing the Immortal Beaming Images of the Great Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il" was posted by the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on its website on August 25.
					 The speech, made by Kim Jong Un at the banquet on August 25, Juche 101 (2012), deals with the Songun feats performed by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It calls for dynamically advancing to win a final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche and the revolutionary cause of Songun started and successfully led by President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Exploits Praised by Ethiopian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Exploits Praised by Ethiopian Organization
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea released a statement on August 20 on the occasion of the Day of Songun in the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Great HE Kim Jong Il who was loyal to the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung performed the immortal exploits before the country and revolution, era and history with his unique Songun politics and won a shining victory in the acute confrontation with the U.S.
					
					 It was thanks to his outstanding Songun leadership that the DPRK emerged a satellite manufacturer and launcher and a nuclear weapons state and could reliably protect the dignity and sovereignty of the country from every move of the imperialists for aggression and their challenge.
					
					 He brought about a turning phase for the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and protected peace in Asia and the rest of the world from the ceaseless war moves of the hostile forces.
					
					 We will make positive efforts to widely study and disseminate the Juche idea and the Songun idea which was founded by Kim Il Sung and developed in depth by Kim Jong Il and apply it to the actual conditions of Ethiopia.
					
					 The exploits performed by Kim Jong Il in the Korean revolution and cause of world peace and security with his tireless Songun leadership for years will remain shining for all ages along with history.
					
					 We are convinced that the dream and ideal of the Korean people are sure to come true as they hold respected HE Kim Jong Un, another Songun brilliant commander, in high esteem.

articles.title: Day of Songun Marked by Russian Political Party and British Organization
articles.content:
Day of Songun Marked by Russian Political Party and British Organization
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- A Russian political party and a British organization posted articles on their websites on August 23 and 25 to mark the Day of Songun in the DPRK.
					 The Party of Communists of Russia noted in an article titled "Day of Songun celebrated in DPRK":
					
					 It was an event of great significance that leader Kim Jong Il provided his first field guidance for his Songun revolutionary leadership to the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on August 25, 1960.
					
					 Since then, he inspected a lot of KPA units to develop it into an invincible army till the last moments of his life.
					
					 Thanks to his commandership the KPA grew to be an elite revolutionary army. It has always emerged victorious in the uninterrupted confrontation with the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces.
					
					 He not only defended the cause of socialism but ushered in a new era of building a thriving nation under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 He led the KPA to take the lead in the drive for building a thriving nation.
					
					 The DPRK is invincible thanks to its single-minded unity, remains strong thanks to self-reliance in defence and is prospering through the industrial revolution in the new century. This eye-opening reality would be unthinkable without his Songun leadership feats.
					
					 His exploits will remain shining forever. 
					
					 The Korean Friendship Association UK praised him developing the KPA into invincible combat ranks and the DPRK into a nuclear weapons state which no one dares provoke and a satellite manufacturer and launcher.

articles.title: Anniversary of DPRK Marked by Bulgarian Organization
articles.content:
Anniversary of DPRK Marked by Bulgarian Organization
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association issued a special bulletin on August 28 to mark the 66th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The bulletin in an article titled "September 9, birthday of DPRK" noted:
					
					 We again recollect the history of the founding of the DPRK with the approach of September 9.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung convened the historic Joint Conference of Representatives of Political Parties and Social Organizations in North and South Korea in Pyongyang in April, 1948, at which he indicated the tasks to be fulfilled by the Korean people in their efforts to set up an all-Korea unified democratic government.
					
					 This led to an all-Korea general election.
					
					 Kim Il Sung declared before the whole world the founding of the DPRK on September 9. 
					
					 The founding of the DPRK marked an event of great significance in the history of socialist Korea.
					
					 Everybody in the DPRK has a stable job and never knows unemployment.
					
					 The state provides the people with dwelling houses and taxation was abolished a long time ago in the DPRK. Free education and healthcare are in force there.
					
					 However, the situation in south Korea is quite contrary to this.
					
					 All the people in the DPRK are turning out in the drive for building a thriving nation.
					
					 We wish them bigger successes in the future, too.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok se reune con primer vicepresidente de Consejo de FR y su comitiva
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok se reune con primer vicepresidente de Consejo de FR y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 2 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, departio el dia 2 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el primer vicepresidente del Consejo de la Federacion de Rusia, Alexandr Torshyn y su comitiva quienes le hicieron una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Rinden tributo a Kim Po Hyon con motivo de 59o aniversario de su deceso
articles.content:
Rinden tributo a Kim Po Hyon con motivo de 59o aniversario de su deceso 
Pyongyang, 2 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 59o aniversario del fallecimiento del ardiente patriota Kim Po Hyon, fueron colocadas este martes las ofrendas florales ante su tumba en Mangyongdae. 
					Alli estaba puesta una ofrenda floral enviada por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea. 
					
					En la ceremonia de homenaje participaron Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, O Su Yong, el vicepremier Im Chol Ung, los funcionarios de organismos del partido y el Poder, entidades de masas, ministerios, organos centrales e instituciones de educacion y trabajadores capitalinos. 
					
					Al pie de la tumba fueron depositadas una ofrenda floral a nombre del Comite Central del PTC y las otras a nombre de entidades de masas, ministerios, organos centrales, escuelas revolucionarias, instituciones de educacion, organismos del partido y el poder y granjas en esta capital. 
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de la noble vida de Kim Po Hyon.

articles.title: Participantes en una conferencia rinden homenaje a Generalisimos
articles.content:
Participantes en una conferencia rinden homenaje a Generalisimos
Pyongyang, 2 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Los participantes en la XIII Conferencia Nacional de Funcionarios de Ensenanza visitaron el dia 2 el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan.
					Ellos rindieron el sublime homenaje a los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il ante sus estatuas de pie y en los salones de eternidad donde estan conservados sus cuerpos.
					
					Luego, pasaron revista a las salas de conservacion de ordenes de los Generalisimos, las otras de conservacion de carros, coche electrico, barco y vagones de tren usados por ellos hasta el ultimo periodo de sus vidas para visitas de orientacion y viajes al extranjero.
